header.p: Here are the Getting Started Guides. They can take you from joining the mailing list and get the source code to running the test suite and RI Server.

section.title: GSG-1 -- Join the mailing list
section.p: The mailing list is your connection to all the developers and members of the OpenEJB community. This document shows you how to subscribe to our main mailing list, the OpenEJB-Dev mailing list. Click here for GSG-1

section.title: GSG-2 -- Get the source: CVS
section.p: Getting involved in any Open Source project requires the source. This document guides you through the process of getting the OpenEJB project source using the CVS command line client. Click here for GSG-2

section.title: GSG-2.2 -- Get the source: WinCVS
section.p: Getting involved in any Open Source project requires the source. This document guides you through the process of getting the OpenEJB project source using the WinCVS client. Click here for GSG-2.2

section.title: GSG-4 -- Run the Test Suite
section.p: This document contains basic information on how to prepare and run the OpenEJB testsuite. Click here for GSG-4

section.title: GSG-5 -- Deploying an EJB jar
section.p: This document contains basic information on how to deploy an EJB jar in OpenEJB. Click here for GSG-5

section.title: CG-1: Contributor's Guide -- Unit Tests
section.p: The perfect place to get involved and gently brought up to speed is by creating unit tests. The unit tests are a fabulous way to get started because it gets you right into the core code right away without needing any knowledge in the overall design. This document details the guidelines for creating unit tests. OpenEJB testsuite. Click here for CG-1
